reviewText: Like most of the other reviewers said, the workout is very dated.  The ab workouts are very good though.  There are some portions where you need some kind of box, but I just used my stability ball and still felt like I got a good workout.  I did feel though that each day's ab routine was too short and I wound up doing about 2 or 3 together.  Otherwise it was pretty good.  Nothing new, but nice combinations.  I didn't try the Tough Tape portion simply because just from looking at the screencaps from the different scence it looked like I needed too much Firm Equipment I didn't have.  All in all, I enjoyed the abs portion.
summary: Liked 5 Day Abs - Didn't try Tough Tape
Title: N/A

reviewText: This workout (or should I call it that) is composed of pieces of all different workouts put together.  There is no class, no instructor, forget about cueing, no rhythm - it's horrible.  The abs part is even worse.  A kindergartener can do it.  5 day abs?  Yeah right.  I'm an advanced exerciser and this workout is a nightmare.  Trust me - DO NOT waste your money.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I used to own this on VHS. I was happy to find it on dvd.The 5 day abs really works. I hate to exercise but I find this tolerable and effective.There are some really silly looking splash screens in between each of the days but dont let that stop you.

reviewText: I missed my old VHS version of the ab workout, and was happy to see this on DVD.  However, the way The Firm set up this DVD you are constantly being bombarded with ads.  The workouts are good once you can get past that, but it does waste a lot of time.Oh well.  Sometimes technological advances are not all they are cracked up to be...

reviewText: Some of these gals on tough tape crack me up, but the moves are tough and they work.  The girl in the beginning is hysterical!  That plastic smile and expressions get me every time - I give it four stars because I am sweating and sore afterwards - thats really all that matters

reviewText: I owned these workouts on VHS, and I now own this DVD. Tough Tape 2 is a compilation workout from some of the Firm's mid-to-late 1990's workouts. It has some great weight-training segments to work your upper and lower body, from Maximum Body Sculpting, Better Body and Buns, Firm Cardio, Firm Strength, and Fat Blaster. It is a lot of fun- the time FLIES by. For the most part, you're alternating lower and upper body work, so real fatigue is minimal. There is no ab work, but that's okay because you have 5-Day Abs on the DVD to add on. I won't say that it has every single body part exhausted by the end of the workout, but it is a good one to add in to your rotation- just be aware it is not the only weights workout you'll ever need in your collection. A nice thing is it's on the shorter side, time-wise- about 45 minutes- so it's easy to work it in on a busy day. And, frankly, sometimes, I just don't have the energy to do an hour or more's work. It IS harder than the Firm workouts made with the last three years or so(for those that have not been impressed with recent Firm workouts...)It may seem a bit dated by today's standards- I don't care about that, but I know it bugs some people. It is a very safe, efficient workout.Five-Day Abs is made up of the abdominal routines of Low Impact Aerobics, Aerobic Interval Training, Time Crunch Workout, Abs, Hips, and Thighs Sculpting, and Complete Aerobic Weight-Training. It's chaptered so you can easily do a segment a day. Yeah, it's dated now. The moves are a bit repetitive. But it works. And it's relatively safe to follow- just watch your neck positioning and be sure to press your lower back to the mat(there are some people with not-so-good form demonstrating in these segments).My DVD also included a Form Pointers segment- nothing new for intermediate to advanced exercisers, but great for a beginner to watch.
Title: N/A
